titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Consumer Reports Archives records RL.11772
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-02-14 21:08:46 UTC.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. The Consumer Reports Archive was first established in 1972 as the Center for the Study of Consumer Movements. Collection includes correspondence, forms, photographs, policy and procedure statements and other printed materials that pertain to the operation support activities of the Consumer Union Archives. Included are files relating to archival administration and records management for the organization, reference requests and reference files relating to exhibit planning, Consumers Union and consumer movement history, and photocopied materials for individual research requests on various subjects. Organization resources include staff biographies; collection finding aids, indexes, and inventories; card and microfiche files. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Office Files; Collection Guides; Staff and Affiliate Biographies; and Reference Card Files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Consumer Reports is a product testing and consumer advocacy nonprofit organization based in Yonkers, N.Y., founded in 1936. The Consumer Reports Archive was first established in 1972 as the Center for the Study of Consumer Movements. It was staffed until 1981 when it closed due to recession-era finances. It re-opened on a part-time basis in 1986, largely to support Consumers Union's 50th anniversary activities. In 1987 the recommendations of a consultant led to the reorganization of the Archive to focus more narrowly on Consumers Union activities and staff.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Consumer Reports Archives records were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Consumer Reports Archives records, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2019-0130

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, forms, photographs, policy and procedure statements and other printed materials that pertain to the operation support activities of the Consumer Union Archives. Included are files relating to archival administration and records management for the organization, reference requests and reference files relating to exhibit planning, Consumers Union and consumer movement history, and photocopied materials for individual research requests on various subjects. Organization resources include staff biographies; collection finding aids, indexes, and inventories; card and microfiche files. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.

controlaccess.subject: Consumer advocacy
controlaccess.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series includes files pertaining to the administration of the archives and Consumer Reports' records management program: donor relations and collection solicitations, forms, policies and procedures, historical photographs of the stacks and reference areas. Series also includes general reference files of material pertaining to consumer movement history, Consumers Union, exhibit planning, and the results of various research projects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Beginning in the mid-1970s, Consumers Union management initiated a project to compile biographical sketches of managerial staff. Around 1978, the Center for the Study of Consumer Movements (the Consumer Reports Archive) reached out to present and former staff and members of the Board of Directors for biographical information, invitations to participate in an oral history interview series, and solicitation for manuscript donations. Series includes correspondence, transcripts of recorded conversations, clippings, obituaries, speeches and other materials collected.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes biographical cards, bibliographies, subject and organizational files, and a subject index to magazine articles up through the early 1990s. Also includes microfiche files on various magazines, technical journals, research reports and library database extraction.
